toolbar.name: Buttons
toolbar.button.language.name: Language
toolbar.button.language.note:
Select a different translation from the 'lang' folder.
Then the application will restart.
toolbar.button.language.note.single: --- Unfortunately, there are no other translation files. :( ---
toolbar.button.about.name: About
toolbar.button.about.about:
This application allows you to search through the possible Pokémon that you can face in the Battle Tower/Arcade/Castle in Platinum, HeartGold, and SoulSilver. Note: the trainer data listed here is inaccurate for the Battle Factory, and the Battle Hall uses a completely different set of Pokémon. These may be added in a future update.
Results are returned in Pokémon Showdown format.

If an error occurs, check the log files in the ‘logs’ folder.

Click the 'Damage Calculator' button to copy the link to Pokémon Showdown's damage calculator to your clipboard.
toolbar.button.about_qt.name: About Qt
toolbar.button.about_qt.tooltip: Show the Qt library's About box

page.welcome.name: Start Page
page.welcome.welcome:
Welcome. Click the button below to load data.
Once completed, additional tabs will appear on the top.
page.all_sets.name: Browse All Sets
page.all_sets.info:
This page simply lets you browse all the possible Pokémon sets in the Battle Frontier.
Select a Pokémon and a set number from the dropdown menus and have a look at the set!
Hover over the labels for some extra info.
page.all_sets.pokemon.tooltip:
The number of possible sets depends on the Pokémon.
Most Pokémon have 4 possible sets.
Weaker Pokémon like mid-stage starters have 2 possible sets.
Very weak Pokémon like first-stage starters have just 1 possible set.
page.all_sets.ivs.tooltip:
Not all IVs are possible in the Battle Frontier.
A Pokémon's IV depends on their trainer.
page.all_sets.ivBox.tooltip.fixed: The IV cannot be changed for these sets.
page.all_sets_by_trainer.name: Browse Sets by Trainer
page.all_sets_by_trainer.tooltip: Browse Pokémon sets organized by opposing trainers.
page.all_sets_by_trainer.info:
This page groups Pokémon sets by trainer. Each trainer has a particular selection of Pokémon they use.
Select a battle number, a trainer class, a trainer name, and then have a look at their Pokémon!
Hover over the labels for some extra info.
page.all_sets_by_trainer.battle_number.t:
Before battle 50, most trainers appear in multiple rounds. For example, Idol Basia can appear in battles 1 - 6 or 7 - 13.
The 7th battle of each round will use a trainer that can appear in the next round. For example, Black Belt Mason can appear in battle 7, or in battles 8 - 13 or 15 - 20.
Starting at battle 50, the trainer at the end of a round isn't any different from the others.
page.all_sets_by_trainer.trainer.tooltip:
Many trainers of the same class use the same sets of Pokémon.
For example: Youngsters Casimir, Erroll, and Jim are all the same.
page.all_sets_by_trainer.pokemon.tooltip:
Before battle 50, all trainers use just one possible set for each of their Pokémon.
Starting at battle 50, trainers may have multiple possible sets for each of their Pokémon.
page.all_sets_by_trainer.darach:
Note:
Castle Valet Darach chooses which set number to use for all his Pokémon when the battle starts.
For example: he may have only set 1 Pokémon or only set 2 Pokémon, but never a mix of the two.
page.all_sets_by_trainer.ivs.tooltip:
A Pokémon's IV depends on their trainer.
Before battle 50, trainer IVs start at 3 and each round adds some trainers with the next multiple of 3. By the seventh round, you may face trainers with 21 IVs.
Starting at battle 50, you'll usually be facing trainers with 31 IVs.
Also, Frontier Brains always have 31 IVs in their battles.
page.generic.result.abilities: This Pokémon's ability may be {0} or {1}.
page.generic.itemCheck.tooltip:
Check this box if you're in the Battle Castle or Battle Arcade.
Pokémon in those facilities won't use the held items listed here.
page.search.name: Search Sets
page.search.tooltip: Figure out what you're battling against.
page.search.info:
This page allows you to search through each individual Pokémon owned by each trainer.
Many trainers have the exact same sets, so only unique results are shown.
page.search.resultsBox.done: Search done: {0} sets found, {1} of which are unique.
page.search.result.none: No results! Try a different search.
